meta.name: keywords
meta.title: Coronavirus Resources & Information | St. Charles Community Unit School District 303

div.p: On April 17, Governor Pritzker announced that he is suspending in-person learning for all Illinois schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Please visit the remote learning page below for more information.

With the health, safety, and well-being of our school community as our priority, St. Charles Community Unit School 303 administration has been closely monitoring developments regarding the respiratory disease caused by a novel (new) coronavirus (COVID-19). We have compiled links to resources both at the national and state levels that will provide you with the most up to date information about COVID-19.

h5.a: Community Resources 2019-2020
Community Resources 2019-2020 SPANISH
COVID-19 FAST Tips on Managing Anxiety
Kane County 211

div.p: Families who need assistance with meals can come to Thompson Middle School, 705 W. Main St. between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. to get "Grab and Go" bags with up to two days worth of food. If you need delivery assistance, please contact the District office at 331.228.2000.

p.i: Las familias que necesiten ayuda con las comidas pueden venir a la escuela secundaria Thompson, 705 W. Main St. entre las 9:00 a.m. y las 11:00 a.m. para conseguir bolsas de comida preparada para dos días. Si necesita ayuda con la entrega de comida, por favor, contacte a la oficina del Distrito al 331.228.2000.

p.br: Food and personal supply donations are accepted between 8:30 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. at the Northern Illinois Foodbank, 273 Dearborn Ct. Geneva, IL.

div.p: Items are distributed at local food pantries. To see a list of distribution locations, please visit the Northern Illinois Foodbank website and enter your zip code.

p.a: Salvation Army Food and Utility Assistance

div.p: This is available to anyone looking for basic needs, crisis and mental health services, financial assistance, health care, support groups, etc.

ul.li: When using this resource, be sure to enter your zip code and city to get local resources
Click on any of the topics listed on the site to get more information
There are some resources for the Hispanic/Latino community as well
You can call 211 for someone to help you over the phone (Se habla espanol)
Ask for eligibility requirements to be sure you meet the criteria for services and have everything you need ready when applying

p.i: PATH está disponible para proporcionar recursos a cualquier persona de la comunidad, incluyendo necesidades básicas, servicios de crisis y de salud mental, asistencia financiera, atención médica, grupos de apoyo, etc. Llame al 211 para que alguien le ayude por teléfono.

ul.li: Assisi Homes Batavia Apartments - Batavia, IL
Batavia Interfaith Food Pantry - Batavia, IL
St. Peter's Food Pantry - Geneva, IL
Neighborhood Food Pantries at Resurrection - Wayne, IL
